business.headline: Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. The PF problem: Why so many employees struggle to access their own moneyEvery month, employees across India save a part of their salary in the Provident Fund. But system errors, bureaucratic delays, and glitches mean that for millions, claiming their own PF money has become a frustrating challenge.

Selling property? Here are 9 smart ways to save on capital gains taxSelling property can bring you a good profit, but it often comes with the worry of paying a hefty capital gains tax. Luckily, the Income Tax Act offers several ways to cut down or even avoid this tax if you plan wisely.

Drawing from her own pregnancy shoots, she highlighted how communication, support systems, and fear of career setbacks continue to shape women's struggles in the film industry.

She addressed challenges including legal cases and stressed communication and content over gender biases.

Cooking doesn't define a woman - lesson 101 from Kunickaa-Tanya's BB 19 clashThe Kunickaa Sadanand vs Tanya Mittal clash in 'Bigg Boss 19' isn't just another kitchen fight, it shines a harsh light on how women empowerment is still misunderstood. Cooking doesn't define a woman, and the explosive debate proves why empowerment is about freedom of choice, not outdated gender roles.

Dhanashree: Getting movie offers for my talent, not because of what happenedChoreographer Dhanashree Verma opened up about getting multiple offers for films in the recent episode of 'Rise & Fall.' She said she is being offered films because of her talent and not what happened in her personal life. Dhanashree and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal got divorced in March 2025.

Punjab floods: Salman's Being Human foundation sends boats, to adopt villagesActor Salman Khan's Being Human foundation has joined the rescue and relief work as Punjab faces floods. The foundation has sent five boats to flood-affected areas. It has also planned to adopt flood-hit border villages near Husainiwala.

Salman Khan cleans up in wounded look from Battle of Galwan's Ladakh shoot. See picActor Salman Khan has shared the first look from his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. The film's climax scenes are currently being shot in Leh and Ladakh. Directed by Apoorva Lakhia, the film recounts the 2020 Galwan Valley clash.

My father used to beat me: Tanya recalls abuse as Kunickaa attacks her in BB 19Tanya Mittal broke down in 'Bigg Boss 19' after Kunickaa Sadanand questioned her upbringing. The influencer recalled facing violence from her father while growing up.

Mirai gets U/A certificate, Teja Sajja calls it experience of emotion and devotionActor Teja Sajja's 'Mirai' has been officially cleared by the CBFC with a U/A certificate ahead of its global release. The upcoming superhero film will be releasing in 2D and 3D formats.
Ali Fazal attends Rule Breakers screening at UK Parliament with MP Alice McDonaldActor Ali Fazal attended the screening of 'Rule Breakers'' at UK Parliament. He was joined by MP Alice McDonald.

general news.headline: Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli resigns amid deadly Gen Z protests, Army appeals for peaceProtests continued in Nepal for the second day despite the government announcing that it had lifted the ban on social media platforms. The second day of demonstrations left two more people dead, pushing the death toll to 22.

Live: Play constructive role in maintaining peace, Nepal Army appeals to Gen ZKP Sharma Oli resigned as Nepal's Prime Minister on Tuesday following violent protests triggered by a ban on major social media platforms and anger over corruption. At least 22 people were killed and hundreds injured as police used deadly force against demonstrators, mostly youths leading what came to be called the "Gen Z" movement. Despite the government rolling back the ban, protests intensified on the second day, with crowds attacking and injuring Nepalese leaders. India Today is reporting live from ground zero in Nepal. Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are present at the scene. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Former Nepal PM's wife dies of burns after protesters set their house on fireAccording to family members, a group of protesters allegedly forced her inside the residence before igniting the blaze. She was rushed to Kirtipur Burn Hospital in critical condition but could not survive her injuries.

Live: Veep election counting begins, NDA sets table for celebration dinnerVice President Election 2025 Voting Live Updates: India will have a new Vice President by Tuesday night, with members of Parliament voting to fill the post left vacant after Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation. The contest has pitted the BJP-led ruling NDA's nominee, Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan, against the opposition INDIA bloc's choice, former Supreme Court judge B Sudershan Reddy. Polling began at 10 am in the new Parliament building, with members of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha eligible to cast their votes until 5 pm. Counting of ballots will start at 6 pm, and the results are expected later in the evening. Although the BJP-led alliance has a numerical advantage, the outcome could hinge on cross-voting since MPs are not bound by a party whip and ballots are cast in secrecy. Stay with IndiaToday.in for live updates

When GenZ gets out of their cyber-dwelling and on to the real streets...fireworks!What began as young people curating songs for Instagram Reels turned into a fight for their digital homes when Nepal's government banned social media. The blackout broke the trance, sparking protests that soon targeted corruption. With 19 dead and the Prime Minister gone, the unrest has laid bare how fragile regimes can be.

Fungus on hands, smelly clothes, can't live in jail: Darshan asks judge for poisonActor Darshan, accused in the Renukaswamy murder case in Karnataka, pleaded with the judge to give him poison, citing unbearable jail conditions. The judge refused his request.

Karisma Kapur's children vs stepmother Priya in lawsuit over Sanjay Kapur's willSanjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Numbers back NDA in vice-presidential election battle, result likely by 8 pmThe election comes fifty days after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from the post on July 21, citing health reasons. The vacancy triggered a fresh contest for the nation's second-highest constitutional office, and with it, a political test of strength between the ruling NDA and the opposition INDIA bloc.

How Nepal is following Bangladesh script, line for line | 5 pointsNepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday after protests by youngsters over social media ban turned into an anti-regime agitation. Nepal's Gen Z protests have uncanny similarities to the Bangladesh agitation from July-August 2024 that toppled the regime of PM Sheikh Hasina. Here's a 5-point explainer.

Noida woman's 'I choose to leave India' post sparks debate on reservation policiesA Noida-based woman shared that she is leaving India to pursue an MBA abroad after failing to secure admission to the institutes she considered the "best" in the country, blaming reservation policies for it. Her LinkedIn post has now sparked a debate on the issue. Read on:

Oli, India and the curious timing of Nepal protestsThe massive protests in Nepal in which 20 people have been killed came ahead of PM KP Sharma Oli's planned trip to India and after his return from China. India's immediate neighbourhood has become a playground of diverse external forces. Though the Gen Z protests seem to be spontaneous, they come amid China-US tug-of-war and can be hijacked, warn experts.

Apple Event 2025 Live Updates: iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max and more expectedApple iPhone 17 Series Launch Event 2025 Live Updates: Three of the incoming iPhones are likely to be on expected lines. These are the iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max. Joining them will be a new iPhone, the long-rumoured and highly anticipated, iPhone 17 Air. Here are the details.

Indian couple assaulted by Chinese man during Switzerland holiday, shares post, picsAn Indian-origin couple alleged that they were brutally assaulted by a Chinese hotel manager during their holiday in Switzerland.

Canada rejects 80% Indian student visas in 2025, top choice status fallsCanada, once a top destination for study-abroad aspirants, rejected 80% of visa applications for Indian students in 2025, the highest in a decade. Barely 9% of Indian study abroad aspirants now see it as the top choice. With growing uncertainty and mounting challenges, what does studying in Canada look like now, and what new study-abroad dreams are Indian students embracing?

With Nepal, India's neighbourhood in turmoil again. US vs China playing out?Nepal protests: What started as an agitation in Nepal against a social media ban, quickly spiralled into protests against corruption, forcing Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. It follows a familiar script that happened in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.
3 soldiers killed as avalanche hits Siachen camp, Army captain rescuedAvalanches are common at Siachen Glacier, located on the northern tip of the Line of Control at a height of around 20,000 feet.

Video: Nepal Parliament, ministers' houses set ablaze; ruckus on roads amid protestsProtests in Nepal entered their second day despite the government reversing its social media ban. Demonstrators demanded Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's ouster after two more deaths pushed the toll to 22 and over 300 injured. On Tuesday, Oli resigned, confirming his decision in a letter, as unrest over the crackdown intensified.

PM surveys damage in flood-hit Himachal, Punjab; announces Rs 3,100 crore packagePM Narendra Modi announced a financial assistance package of Rs 1,500 crore for flood and landslide-hit Himachal Pradesh and Rs 1,600 crore for Punjab. He said the Centre would ensure full support in rebuilding and restoration.

Watch: India Today reports from epicentre of Nepal's massive Gen Z uprisingKathmandu is seething. For the second day in a row, Nepal's youth-led uprising raged on, defying curbs on public gatherings and a heavy security clampdown. The turmoil culminated on Tuesday with Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's resignation, hours after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office shouting anti-government slogans.

"This protest is not only about the social media ban, but about the corruption happening under Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's government. We are forced to take the route of violence to show dissent. Children were killed yesterday. They could have handled it peacefully, but instead they shot us," a protester told India Today TV. 

On Monday, violence reached a flashpoint. At least 20 people were killed and more than 300 injured in the violent clashes. Four more were reported injured on Tuesday. The agitators torched Prime Minister Oli's residence in Balkot. They also attacked the house of former home minister Ramesh Lekhak, who resigned a day earlier.

The 1963 Hazratbal Crisis: Turning Point in Kashmir's Political and Religious TurmoilIn 1963, the disappearance of a sacred relic from Hazratbal Shrine triggered mass unrest, political conspiracies, and enduring debates, marking a pivotal moment in Kashmir's religious and political history.

Who is Balen Shah, Gen Z protesters' favourite for Nepal PM?Balen Shah, Kathmandu's mayor and former rapper, has emerged as a trusted leader for Nepal's Gen Z, earning admiration for supporting the agitation against corruption and social media ban. Gen Zers, who forced out KP Sharma Oli from power, are batting for Shah to take over. Shah's 2022 victory symbolised a generational shift in Nepali politics.

Video: Nepal Finance Minister chased on street, kicked, thrashed by protestersNepal's Finance Minister Bishnu Prasad Paudel was attacked by protesters during intense Gen Z protests. The violent clashes erupted as thousands of young protesters confronted security forces in Kathmandu and several other cities across the country. Despite the government lifting the ban on social media platforms, protests in Nepal persisted into their second day. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Oli said he was stepping down "to facilitate a solution to the problem and to help resolve it politically." The first day of Gen Z protests left 20 people dead and more than 250 injured.

Can 18% GST on private coaching finally cure India's tuition obsession?Despite the 18% GST on private coaching and tuition, the industry is booming, driven by parental pressure, fast-evolving curricula, peer competition, and changing family patterns. With nearly one in three students enrolled in tuition classes, can GST ever deter India's coaching obsession?

India asks citizens to avoid Nepal travel, those there to avoid stepping outIndia has advised its citizens in Nepal to avoid travel and shared helpline numbers for those stranded in the Himalayan nation after violent Gen Z protests left at least 22 dead and prompted curfews in several cities.

sports.headline: Dewald Brevis sold for record-breaking R 16.5 million as Super Kings lose starDewald Brevis became the most expensive player in SA20 history, being sold at R16.5 million. Pretoria Capitals secured the young star amid intense bidding from Joburg Super Kings.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
